title: Inderbir Singh's Textbook of Human Neuroanatomy (10th Ed)(gnv64)
description: Inderbir Singh's Textbook of Human Neuroanatomy (10th Ed) By Pritha S Bhuiyan, Lakshmi Rajgopal, K Shyamkishore Jaypee Brothers | November 2017 | ISBN-10: 9352701488 | PDF | 273 pages | 23 MB This new edition is a comprehensive guide to the anatomy of the nervous system, for undergraduate medical students. Beginning with a general introduction to neuroanatomy, the following chapters each cover a different section, from the spinal cord, brainstem and cranial nerves, to the limbic system, autonomous nervous system, and much more. Each chapter features key learning objectives, clinical anatomy, and short notes, as well as multiple choice questions for self-assessment. Anatomical aspects of neurological conditions are illustrated in colour boxes and clinical cases have been added to each topic. The text is highly illustrated with clinical images including high resolution brain specimen photographs. Key points: - Fully revised, new edition providing undergraduates with a comprehensive guide to neuroanatomy - Each chapter includes multiple choice questions for self-assessment - Features high resolution brain specimen photographs CONTENTS 1. Introduction to Nervous System 1 2. Spinal Cord—External Features 22 3. Spinal Cord—Internal Features 36 4. Brainstem: External Features 56 5. Brainstem: Internal Features 64 6. Cranial Nerves 81 7. Pathways of Special Senses 110 8. Cerebellum 124 9. Diencephalon.141 10. Cerebral Hemispheres: External Features.163 11. White Matter of Cerebral Hemispheres 183 12. Basal Nuclei (Basal Ganglia) 193 13. Limbic System and Reticular Formation .200 14. Autonomic Nervous System. Efferent Autonomic Pathway 211 15. Ventricles of the Brain and CSF Circulation228 16.
